courseList.name: Calculus BC
courseList.subject: Mathematics
courseList.description: Calculus BC is a very difficult freshman year course in college that is heavily involved in differentiation and integration.

contents.title: Calculus 1 - Introduction to Limits
contents.description: Limits explained for people who have never seen them before by The Organic Chemistry Tutor. This is a very good video.

contents.title: Limits - Evaluating
contents.description: A Mathisfun page that explores many examples of limits using great visuals and graphs.

contents.title: Basic, Dumbed Down Summary of Limits
contents.description: Limits are basically the value a graph approaches from either side of the point. They can be estimated and evaluated to help us make calculations and asssumptions in calculus.
contents.data: Limits are basically the value a graph approaches from either side of the point. They can be estimated and evaluated to help us make calculations and assumptions in calculus.

contents.title: A Discontinuous Function
contents.description: Because the limits approach different values from both sides, the graph is discontinuous.
